In the free flight menu, I select the 4X and I just get  fatal error.  I don't see any .dll crashes in my error reports either.  Can you verify which gauges are installed into FSX?  I'm not seeing and Diamond Katana gauges in my folder.  Thanks!

Ok everything is working great now.  It was my RXP_GNS .dll that was crashing.  I didn't realize this panel had an entry for the rxp so I had to modify it just a tad.  Works good now though.  Thanks again for this great airplane.  I did my RW training in this airplane when it first came out.

If you have the GNS 530, the one cracked by Dcrack :
http://thepiratebay.org/torrent/5613243/Reality_XP_WX500_and_GNS_WAAS_for_FSX_by_DCrack_--_NEW

then you just have to modidy the 'panel.cfg' file inside the default installation path :
C:\Program Files\Microsoft Games\Microsoft Flight Simulator X\SimObjects\Airplanes\Diamond DA20-100 'Katana'\panel
In the [Vcockpit00] section
I have 
gauge45=DCrackXPGNS!A,0,0,0,0
gauge46=fs9gps!gps_500,                 1244,   12,  790, 742
gauge47=rxpGNS!GNS530,                  1245, 1140,  790, 570

Then you can select the Katana without crashing.
Inside you can install the Reality GNS 530 instead of the basic FSX GPS. It will update for a few seconds then it will work great.
